description: This segment carries information on a patient's death and possible autopsy.

1.name: Death Cause Code
1.description: This field is valued with the reason of the death.

2.name: Death Location
2.description: This field is valued with the place the death occurred.

3.name: Death Certified Indicator
3.description: This field indicates whether a death was officially certified or not. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator for valid values.
3.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

4.name: Death Certificate Signed Date/Time
4.description: This field is valued with the date and time the death certificate was signed.

5.name: Death Certified By
5.description: This field is valued with the person who signed the death certificate.
5.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons

6.name: Autopsy Indicator
6.description: This field indicates whether an autopsy was performed. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator for valid values.
6.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

7.name: Autopsy Start and End Date/Time
7.description: If an autopsy is performed, this field is valued with the date and time the autopsy was begun and completed

8.name: Autopsy Performed By
8.description: This field is valued with the authority who performed the autopsy.
8.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons

9.name: Coroner Indicator
9.description: This flag indicates whether the case/death has been assigned to the coroner/medical examiner for investigative purposed. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator for valid values.
9.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables
